meanings.definition: The property of exhibiting different colors when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent1: The dichroisms of the crystal were fascinating as it changed from blue to green.
meanings.sent2: The artist used dichroisms in the painting to create a unique visual effect.
meanings.sent3: The dichroisms of the chameleon made it the best-dressed reptile in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like the dichroisms of a gemstone, shifting unpredictably throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The dichroisms of the soap bubble shimmered in the sunlight, captivating everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of having two different colors.
meanings.sent1: The dichroisms of the flower petals made them look like they were dipped in two different paints.
meanings.sent2: The dichroisms of the butterfly's wings were a result of its unique genetic makeup.
meanings.sent3: The dichroisms of the traffic lights confused the colorblind driver.
meanings.sent4: The dichroisms of the rainbow after the storm were a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The dichroisms of the sunset painted the sky with hues of orange and pink.
